intro: Fagopyrum tataricum var. vulgare, commonly known as common buckwheat, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It features upright stems covered in fine hairs, with trifoliate leaves that have three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are followed by triangular, three-lobed seed pods. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often used in ecological restoration projects. Additionally, its seeds are a traditional food source in some cultures.
